page.title: 04The Rose and Crown.
page.content: As far back as 1577 William Chatner kept a public house in Brailsford.By the beginning of the 19th Century there were three public houses in the village.In 1911 only the Rose and Crown remained.It was bought from the Dalton family by Offilers Brewery,now Bass Worthington.The Rose and Crown is now occupied by Ian and Shirley Gray,who have been there for eighteen months.They sell about 200 gallons of beer each week,as well as spirits,soft drinks and food,which is served as bar snacks or in the restaurant.The property has 3.5 acres of land which will be developed to increase the facilities that can be offered.The car park,at present,has spaces for 70 cars but this is not enough because there are residential facilities which have never been fully developed.
